title: Compiler bug when running cargo run.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

### Code

I can't provide code.


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597
commit-date: 2021-03-24
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.53.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.0
```

### Error output

```
   Compiling snowDB v0.1.0 (C:\Users\hp\Desktop\SnowDBRust)
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'found unstable fingerprints for predicates_of(core[f48f]::ops::deref::Deref): GenericPredicates { parent: None, predicates: [(Binder(TraitPredicate(<Self as lazy_static::__Deref>)), C:\Users\hp\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\ops\deref.rs:64:1: 64:16 (#0))] }', /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597\compiler\rustc_query_system\src\query\plumbing.rs:593:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [predicates_of] computing predicates of `lazy_static::__Deref`
#1 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `<impl at C:\Users\hp\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\lazy_static-1.4.0\src\lib.rs:133:9: 146:10>` is well-formed
end of query stack
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'found unstable fingerprints for predicates_of(core[f48f]::marker::Sync): GenericPredicates { parent: None, predicates: [(Binder(TraitPredicate(<Self as std::marker::Sync>)), C:\Users\hp\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\marker.rs:469:1: 469:27 (#0))] }', /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597\compiler\rustc_query_system\src\query\plumbing.rs:593:5

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [predicates_of] computing predicates of `std::marker::Sync`
#1 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `std::string::String: std::marker::Sync`
end of query stack
error: could not compile `snowDB`
```

My dependencies - 
```
rocket = "0.4.7"
sha256 = "1.0.0"
lazy_static = "1.4.0"
dirs-next = "2.0.0"
```
